reviewText:
Short version: 66%The Moorhuhn gallery shooters are a thing of the past, but they are still fun enough to play for nostalgia. And this one, Moorhuhn X, is probably one of the best in the series.

Long version:While the franchise branched into several genres, most Moorhuhns games are one-level gallery shooters, where you shoot a great number of chickens with your shotgun. Why? There is no real reason. We just loved shooting video game chickens in Europe near the turn of the century.

The store title is misleading, because this game here is actually a remake of the fifth instalment of the main series, originally called Moorhuhn X. It was sort of a turning point back then, where they introduced a new chicken design and a bonus level (although reaching it is quite tricky).
Moorhuhn X is also considered to be the best of the series by many, thanks to the fun level design full of secrets to explore in the allotted short time limit. Still, by today’s standards, it is still nothing more than a one-off novelty game made for those who want a little nostalgia.

reviewText:
5min of gameplay
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uXevlHl3KnA

This is like a light gun game but you left click to shoot and right click to reload.
Basically you just shoot as many chickens within the time limit to increase your score.
There are also other things in the background you can shoot and some of the chickens take a little figuring out to take down.
There only seems to be 1 board and you need to shoot ahead of the chickens on kites to hit them and I'm not sure if this is a flaw or if its supposed to simulate a long range shot.
This is a really old game ported to steam and some have reported issues but i didn't run into any.
voteText: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Well this is one game I would have appreciated an honest review on before purchasing.  Even spending a measly .50 cents on sale was regrettable.

All the game amounts to is one scene where you shoot with one type of gun (sorry, never saw that special gun in the video up top).  You are given only 1 minute and 30 seconds to shoot a bunch of chickens and a few obstacles.  Then the game kicks you to a high score screen.

That's seriously all there is to it. No other scenes, no extended time,  no game modes, and no real options other than audio off/on and language-select. Plus, there's no obvious 'win' state - just a high scores screen.

Save your money and play a free shooting gallery game on the interwebs.

reviewText:
Having an terrible day? Why don't just shoot it out in one of the most well known games of the late 90's?

Crazy Chicken had an small world wide success while being a big thing in germany with many different versions and it also crossed over to become screensaver or wallpaper for many office desktops. The Moorhuhn" game series (german title) was  incredible and even today no one knows why. Maybe we germans just got so much suppressed anger in us that we need to kill poor little animals with an shotgun to the face while they smile at us with no fear in their eyes.

Anyway

reviewText:
This is an old game released in the late 90s and for some reasons resurfaced in a bundle.  Good memories in mind, I go ahead and purchase the bundle (and paid far less than the $1.99 on Steam) for it.

Crazy chicken is a pretty basic game where you have to shoot as much as chicken possible in 1:30 min.  The control somehow seems to have changed from the .EXE standalone and using the left mouse button for both shooting and moving the mouse is not a good control design.

The game might be good if you have like 5 min to kill or trying to release some steam at work (assuming you can install Steam on computer at work), but besides that... the game becomes really boring really fast especially the extra funny stuff in the background tend to repeat and are not longer funny (or weird if you caught the sheeps fornicating in the back).

The only use I could see for this game as some sort of entertainment is for drinking party... Get drunk and see how you and your guesses handle shooting chicken while being impaired.  I am not sure that a valid use to spend $1.99.
